required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Aspheric Toric Intraocular Lens (IOL) Implantation Versus Aspheric Non-Toric Lens Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Prospective, Multi-Center, Patient-Masked, Bilateral Comparison of Aspheric Toric Intraocular Lens (IOL) Implantation Versus Aspheric Non-Toric Lens Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate and compare uncorrected distance visual acuity measurement in pseudophakic subjects with bilateral implantation of an AcrySof IQ Toric Intraocular Lens (IOL) versus bilateral implantation of an AcrySof IQ IOL.

primary_outcome.measure: Monocular Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (Monocular UCDVA) at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Uncorrected visual acuity (i.e., visual acuity measured without spectacles or other visual corrective devices) was assessed using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study charts at 100% contrast and measured in logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR). Each eye was assessed, and both eyes contributed to the mean. LogMAR 0.00 is equivalent of 20/20 and LogMAR 1.0 is equivalent of 20/200. A more negative logMAR value would indicate a greater improvement in visual acuity.

arm_group.description: AcrySof IQ Toric IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

AcrySof IQ IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

intervention.description: Commercially available, acrylic, multifocal IOL intended to provide visual correction over the lifetime of the cataract patient
intervention.other_name: AcrySof速 IQ Toric IOL Models SN6AT3, SN6AT4, SN6AT5, SN6AT6, SN6AT7, SN6AT8, or SN6AT9

intervention.description: Commercially available, acrylic, monofocal IOL intended to provide visual correction over the lifetime of the cataract patient

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from one study center located in Russia.

group.title: Toric T3 - T9
group.description: AcrySof IQ Toric IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

group.description: AcrySof IQ IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

outcome.title: Monocular Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (Monocular UCDVA) at Month 3
outcome.description: Uncorrected visual acuity (i.e., visual acuity measured without spectacles or other visual corrective devices) was assessed using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study charts at 100% contrast and measured in logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR). Each eye was assessed, and both eyes contributed to the mean. LogMAR 0.00 is equivalent of 20/20 and LogMAR 1.0 is equivalent of 20/200. A more negative logMAR value would indicate a greater improvement in visual acuity.
outcome.population: Per protocol: All subjects who received IOLs in both eyes and followed the protocol with no major protocol deviations.

group.title: Toric T3 - T9
group.description: AcrySof IQ Toric IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

group.title: IQ SN60WF
group.description: AcrySof IQ IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

measure.title: Monocular Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity (Monocular UCDVA) at Month 3
measure.description: Uncorrected visual acuity (i.e., visual acuity measured without spectacles or other visual corrective devices) was assessed using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study charts at 100% contrast and measured in logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR). Each eye was assessed, and both eyes contributed to the mean. LogMAR 0.00 is equivalent of 20/20 and LogMAR 1.0 is equivalent of 20/200. A more negative logMAR value would indicate a greater improvement in visual acuity.
measure.population: Per protocol: All subjects who received IOLs in both eyes and followed the protocol with no major protocol deviations.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study. An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject regardless of whether or not the event had a causal relationship with the medical device under investigation.
reported_events.desc: The safety population included all enrolled subjects who received at least one IOL and reported at least one safety assessment.

group.title: Toric T3 - T9

group.description: AcrySof IQ IOL surgically implanted in the capsular bag of the eye following cataract removal. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye implanted at least 1 week after and within 1 month of the first eye.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was considered a pilot study and did not have an expectation to meet any of the study endpoints.
